channel.title: CVE Feed for Mattermost -- Mattermost
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Mattermost -- Mattermost

item.title: CVE-2023-7114|2024-09-09T17:28:54.020Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost version 2.10.0 and earlier fails to sanitize deeplink paths, which allows an attacker to perform CSRF attacks against the server.

item.title: CVE-2024-28949|2024-09-03T18:35:47.389Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Server versions 9.5.x before 9.5.2, 9.4.x before 9.4.4, 9.3.x before 9.3.3, 8.1.x before 8.1.11 don't limit the number of user preferences which allows an attacker to send a large number of user preferences potentially causing denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-43105|2024-08-23T16:47:53.315Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Plugin Channel Export versions <=1.0.0 fail to restrict concurrent runs of the /export command which allows a user to consume excessive resource by running the /export command multiple times at once.

item.title: CVE-2024-43813|2024-08-22T19:53:37.226Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0 fail to enforce proper access controls which allows any authenticated user, including guests, to mark any channel inside any team as read for any user.

item.title: CVE-2024-43780|2024-08-22T16:06:25.703Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.0, 9.8.x <= 9.8.2 fail to enforce permissions which allows a guest user with read access to upload files to a channel.

item.title: CVE-2024-39836|2024-08-22T16:39:21.881Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0 and 9.8.x <= 9.8.2 fail to ensure that remote/synthetic users cannot create sessions or reset passwords, which allows the munged email addresses, created by shared channels, to be used to receive email notifications and to reset passwords, when they are valid, functional emails.

item.title: CVE-2024-40886|2024-08-22T13:14:08.968Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0, 9.8.x <= 9.8.2 fail to sanitize user inputs in the frontend that are used for redirection which allows for a one-click client-side path traversal that is leading to CSRF in User Management page of the system console.

item.title: CVE-2024-42411|2024-08-22T13:22:35.586Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0, 9.8.x <= 9.8.2 fail to restrict the input in POST /api/v4/users which allows a user to manipulate the creation date in POST /api/v4/users tricking the admin into believing their account is much older.

item.title: CVE-2024-39810|2024-08-22T12:58:12.173Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.7 and 9.10.x <= 9.10.0 fail to time limit and size limit the CA path file in the ElasticSearch configuration which allows a System Role with access to the Elasticsearch system console to add any file as a CA path field, such as /dev/zero and, after testing the connection, cause the application to crash.

item.title: CVE-2024-32939|2024-08-22T13:26:55.790Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0, 9.8.x <= 9.8.2, when shared channels are enabled, fail to redact remote users' original email addresses stored in user props when email addresses are otherwise configured not to be visible in the local server."

item.title: CVE-2024-8071|2024-08-22T13:33:55.204Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0 and 9.8.x <= 9.8.2 fail to restrict which roles can promote a user as system admin which allows a System Role with edit access to the permissions section of system console to update their role (e.g. member) to include the `manage_system` permission, effectively becoming a System Admin.

item.title: CVE-2024-41144|2024-08-05T16:58:34.663Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5, 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to properly validate synced posts, when shared channels are enabled, which allows a malicious remote to create/update/delete arbitrary posts in arbitrary channels

item.title: CVE-2024-36492|2024-08-05T16:57:11.289Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5, 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to disallow the modification of local users when syncing users in shared channels. which allows a malicious remote to overwrite an existing local user.

item.title: CVE-2024-2450|2024-08-02T20:35:32.666Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 8.1.x before 8.1.10, 9.2.x before 9.2.6, 9.3.x before 9.3.2, and 9.4.x before 9.4.3 fail to correctly verify account ownership when switching from email to SAML authentication, allowing an authenticated attacker to take over other user accounts via a crafted switch request under specific conditions.

item.title: CVE-2024-41162|2024-08-02T15:01:29.868Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5 and 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to disallow the modification of local channels by a remote, when shared channels are enabled, which allows a malicious remote to make an arbitrary local channel read-only.

item.title: CVE-2024-39361|2024-08-02T04:26:14.801Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.8.0, 9.7.x <= 9.7.4, 9.6.x <= 9.6.2 and 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 fail to prevent users from specifying a RemoteId for their posts which allows an attacker to specify both a remoteId and the post ID, resulting in creating a post with a user-defined post ID. This can cause some broken functionality in the channel or thread with user-defined posts

item.title: CVE-2024-39767|2024-08-02T04:26:15.989Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Mobile Apps versions <=2.16.0 fail to validate that the push notifications received for a server actually came from this serve that which allows a malicious server to send push notifications with another server’s diagnostic ID or server URL and have them show up in mobile apps as that server’s push notifications.

item.title: CVE-2024-39353|2024-08-02T04:26:15.306Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 and 9.8.0 fail to sanitize the RemoteClusterFrame payloads before audit logging them which allows a high privileged attacker with access to the audit logs to read message contents.

item.title: CVE-2024-39807|2024-08-02T04:26:16.012Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 and 9.8.0 fail to properly sanitize the recipients of a webhook event which allows an attacker monitoring webhook events to retrieve the channel IDs of archived or restored channels.

item.title: CVE-2024-39830|2024-08-02T04:26:16.020Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.8.x <= 9.8.0, 9.7.x <= 9.7.4, 9.6.x <= 9.6.2 and 9.5.x <= 9.5.5, when shared channels are enabled, fail to use constant time comparison for remote cluster tokens which allows an attacker to retrieve the remote cluster token via a timing attack during remote cluster token comparison.

item.title: CVE-2024-34152|2024-08-02T02:51:11.224Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to perform proper access control which allows a guest to get the metadata of a public playbook run that linked to the channel they are guest via sending an RHSRuns GraphQL query request to the server

item.title: CVE-2024-32945|2024-08-02T02:27:52.391Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Mobile Apps versions <=2.16.0 fail to protect against abuse of a globally shared MathJax state which allows an attacker to change the contents of a LateX post, by creating another post with specific macro definitions.

item.title: CVE-2024-34029|2024-08-02T02:42:59.966Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.7.x <= 9.7.1 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to perform a proper authorization check in the /api/v4/groups//channels//link endpoint which allows a user to learn the members of an AD/LDAP group that is linked to a team by adding the group to a channel, even if the user has no access to the team.

item.title: CVE-2024-29215|2024-08-02T01:10:54.568Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.7.x <= 9.7.1, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1, 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to enforce proper access control which allows a user to run a slash command in a channel they are not a member of via linking a playbook run to that channel and running a slash command as a playbook task command.

item.title: CVE-2024-29221|2024-08-02T01:10:54.523Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Improper Access Control in Mattermost Server versions 9.5.x before 9.5.2, 9.4.x before 9.4.4, 9.3.x before 9.3.3, 8.1.x before 8.1.11 lacked proper access control in the `/api/v4/users/me/teams` endpoint allowing a team admin to get the invite ID of their team, thus allowing them to invite users, even if the "Add Members" permission was explicitly removed from team admins.

item.title: CVE-2024-28053|2024-08-02T00:48:47.805Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Resource Exhaustion in Mattermost Server versions 8.1.x before 8.1.10 fails to limit the size of the payload that can be read and parsed allowing an attacker to send a very large email payload and crash the server.

item.title: CVE-2024-28949|2024-08-02T01:03:51.100Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Server versions 9.5.x before 9.5.2, 9.4.x before 9.4.4, 9.3.x before 9.3.3, 8.1.x before 8.1.11 don't limit the number of user preferences which allows an attacker to send a large number of user preferences potentially causing denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-6428|2024-08-01T21:41:03.285Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.8.0, 9.7.x <= 9.7.4, 9.6.x <= 9.6.2, 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 fail to prevent specifying a RemoteId when creating a new user which allows an attacker to specify both a remoteId and the user ID, resulting in creating a user with a user-defined user ID. This can cause some broken functionality in User Management such administrative actions against the user not working.

item.title: CVE-2024-5270|2024-08-01T21:11:12.407Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.7.x <= 9.7.1, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to check if the email signup configuration option is enabled when a user requests to switch from SAML to Email. This allows the user to switch their authentication mail from SAML to email and possibly edit personal details that were otherwise non-editable and provided by the SAML provider.

item.title: CVE-2024-5272|2024-08-01T21:11:12.451Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1, 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to restrict the audience of the "custom_playbooks_playbook_run_updated" webhook event, which allows a guest on a channel with a playbook run linked to see all the details of the playbook run when the run is marked by finished.

item.title: CVE-2024-2450|2024-08-01T19:11:53.648Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 8.1.x before 8.1.10, 9.2.x before 9.2.6, 9.3.x before 9.3.2, and 9.4.x before 9.4.3 fail to correctly verify account ownership when switching from email to SAML authentication, allowing an authenticated attacker to take over other user accounts via a crafted switch request under specific conditions.

item.title: CVE-2024-2447|2024-08-01T19:11:53.562Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 8.1.x before 8.1.11, 9.3.x before 9.3.3, 9.4.x before 9.4.4, and 9.5.x before 9.5.2 fail to authenticate the source of certain types of post actions, allowing an authenticated attacker to create posts as other users via a crafted post action.

item.title: CVE-2024-2445|2024-08-01T19:11:53.602Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Jira plugin versions shipped with Mattermost versions 8.1.x before 8.1.10, 9.2.x before 9.2.6, 9.3.x before 9.3.2, and 9.4.x before 9.4.3 fail to escape user-controlled outputs when generating HTML pages, which allows an attacker to perform reflected cross-site scripting attacks against the users of the Mattermost server.

item.title: CVE-2024-2446|2024-08-01T19:11:53.477Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 8.1.x before 8.1.10, 9.2.x before 9.2.6, 9.3.x before 9.3.2, and 9.4.x before 9.4.3 fail to limit the number of @-mentions processed per message, allowing an authenticated attacker to crash the client applications of other users via large, crafted messages.

item.title: CVE-2024-39777|2024-08-01T16:07:03.592Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5 and 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to disallow unsolicited invites to expose access to local channels, when shared channels are enabled, which allows a malicious remote to send an invite with the ID of an existing local channel, and that local channel will then become shared without the consent of the local admin.

item.title: CVE-2024-2447|2024-07-29T15:51:20.770Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 8.1.x before 8.1.11, 9.3.x before 9.3.3, 9.4.x before 9.4.4, and 9.5.x before 9.5.2 fail to authenticate the source of certain types of post actions, allowing an authenticated attacker to create posts as other users via a crafted post action.

item.title: CVE-2024-39767|2024-07-19T20:01:48.007Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Mobile Apps versions <=2.16.0 fail to validate that the push notifications received for a server actually came from this serve that which allows a malicious server to send push notifications with another server’s diagnostic ID or server URL and have them show up in mobile apps as that server’s push notifications.

item.title: CVE-2024-39353|2024-07-15T18:33:08.378Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 and 9.8.0 fail to sanitize the RemoteClusterFrame payloads before audit logging them which allows a high privileged attacker with access to the audit logs to read message contents.

item.title: CVE-2024-39767|2024-07-15T08:43:10.236Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Mobile Apps versions <=2.16.0 fail to validate that the push notifications received for a server actually came from this serve that which allows a malicious server to send push notifications with another server’s diagnostic ID or server URL and have them show up in mobile apps as that server’s push notifications.

item.title: CVE-2024-32945|2024-07-15T08:42:19.268Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Mobile Apps versions <=2.16.0 fail to protect against abuse of a globally shared MathJax state which allows an attacker to change the contents of a LateX post, by creating another post with specific macro definitions.

item.title: CVE-2024-39807|2024-07-03T20:06:19.128Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 and 9.8.0 fail to properly sanitize the recipients of a webhook event which allows an attacker monitoring webhook events to retrieve the channel IDs of archived or restored channels.

item.title: CVE-2024-36257|2024-07-03T13:37:07.512Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 and 9.8.0, when using shared channels with multiple remote servers connected, fail to check that the remote server A requesting the server B to update the profile picture of a user is the remote that actually has the user as a local one . This allows a malicious remote A to change the profile images of users that belong to another remote server C that is connected to the server A.

item.title: CVE-2024-6428|2024-07-03T13:25:17.295Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.8.0, 9.7.x <= 9.7.4, 9.6.x <= 9.6.2, 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 fail to prevent specifying a RemoteId when creating a new user which allows an attacker to specify both a remoteId and the user ID, resulting in creating a user with a user-defined user ID. This can cause some broken functionality in User Management such administrative actions against the user not working.

item.title: CVE-2024-39830|2024-07-03T13:40:13.377Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.8.x <= 9.8.0, 9.7.x <= 9.7.4, 9.6.x <= 9.6.2 and 9.5.x <= 9.5.5, when shared channels are enabled, fail to use constant time comparison for remote cluster tokens which allows an attacker to retrieve the remote cluster token via a timing attack during remote cluster token comparison.

item.title: CVE-2024-37182|2024-06-15T20:34:22.877Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Desktop App versions <=5.7.0 fail to correctly prompt for permission when opening external URLs which allows a remote attacker to force a victim over the Internet to run arbitrary programs on the victim's system via custom URI schemes.

item.title: CVE-2024-37182|2024-06-14T08:39:19.578Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Desktop App versions <=5.7.0 fail to correctly prompt for permission when opening external URLs which allows a remote attacker to force a victim over the Internet to run arbitrary programs on the victim's system via custom URI schemes.

item.title: CVE-2024-36287|2024-06-14T08:39:08.132Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Desktop App versions <=5.7.0 fail to disable certain Electron debug flags which allows for bypassing TCC restrictions on macOS.

item.title: CVE-2024-2447|2024-04-05T08:52:59.664Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 8.1.x before 8.1.11, 9.3.x before 9.3.3, 9.4.x before 9.4.4, and 9.5.x before 9.5.2 fail to authenticate the source of certain types of post actions, allowing an authenticated attacker to create posts as other users via a crafted post action.

item.title: CVE-2024-2450|2024-03-15T09:12:28.880Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 8.1.x before 8.1.10, 9.2.x before 9.2.6, 9.3.x before 9.3.2, and 9.4.x before 9.4.3 fail to correctly verify account ownership when switching from email to SAML authentication, allowing an authenticated attacker to take over other user accounts via a crafted switch request under specific conditions.

item.title: CVE-2024-2446|2024-06-04T17:29:50.343Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 8.1.x before 8.1.10, 9.2.x before 9.2.6, 9.3.x before 9.3.2, and 9.4.x before 9.4.3 fail to limit the number of @-mentions processed per message, allowing an authenticated attacker to crash the client applications of other users via large, crafted messages.

item.title: CVE-2024-2445|2024-06-04T17:30:11.664Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Jira plugin versions shipped with Mattermost versions 8.1.x before 8.1.10, 9.2.x before 9.2.6, 9.3.x before 9.3.2, and 9.4.x before 9.4.3 fail to escape user-controlled outputs when generating HTML pages, which allows an attacker to perform reflected cross-site scripting attacks against the users of the Mattermost server.

item.title: CVE-2024-3872|2024-06-04T17:32:17.435Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Mobile app versions 2.13.0 and earlier use a regular expression with polynomial complexity to parse certain deeplinks, which allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to freeze or crash the app via a long maliciously crafted link.

item.title: CVE-2024-31859|2024-06-04T17:37:03.781Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to perform proper authorization checks which allows a member running a playbook in an existing channel to be promoted to a channel admin

item.title: CVE-2024-21848|2024-04-05T08:13:01.713Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Improper Access Control in Mattermost Server versions 8.1.x before 8.1.11 allows an attacker that is in a channel with an active call to keep participating in the call even if they are removed from the channel

item.title: CVE-2024-34029|2024-06-04T17:41:10.035Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.7.x <= 9.7.1 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to perform a proper authorization check in the /api/v4/groups//channels//link endpoint which allows a user to learn the members of an AD/LDAP group that is linked to a team by adding the group to a channel, even if the user has no access to the team.

item.title: CVE-2024-34152|2024-05-26T13:28:16.722Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to perform proper access control which allows a guest to get the metadata of a public playbook run that linked to the channel they are guest via sending an RHSRuns GraphQL query request to the server

item.title: CVE-2024-36255|2024-06-04T17:47:35.787Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to perform proper input validation on post actions which allows an attacker to run a playbook checklist task command as another user via creating and sharing a deceptive post action that unexpectedly runs a slash command in some arbitrary channel.

item.title: CVE-2024-36241|2024-06-10T17:41:28.361Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to enforce proper access controls which allows user to view arbitrary post contents via the /playbook add slash command

item.title: CVE-2024-32046|2024-06-04T17:50:31.884Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.6.x <= 9.6.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.2, 9.4.x <= 9.4.4 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.11 fail to remove detailed error messages in API requests even if the developer mode is off which allows an attacker to get information about the server such as the full path were files are stored

item.title: CVE-2024-32045|2024-06-07T19:55:13.240Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1, 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to enforce proper access controls for channel and team membership when linking a playbook run to a channel which allows members to link their runs to private channels they were not members of.

item.title: CVE-2024-22091|2024-06-04T17:52:42.979Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 8.1.x <= 8.1.10, 9.6.x <= 9.6.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.2 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.11 fail to limit the size of a request path that includes user inputs which allows an attacker to cause excessive resource consumption, possibly leading to a DoS via sending large request paths

item.title: CVE-2024-4198|2024-04-26T08:26:11.493Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.6.0, 9.5.x before 9.5.3, and 8.1.x before 8.1.12 fail to fully validate role changes which allows an attacker authenticated as team admin to demote users to guest via crafted HTTP requests.

item.title: CVE-2024-4182|2024-06-04T17:54:13.942Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.6.0, 9.5.x before 9.5.3, 9.4.x before 9.4.5, and 8.1.x before 8.1.12 fail to handle JSON parsing errors in custom status values, which allows an authenticated attacker to crash other users' web clients via a malformed custom status.

item.title: CVE-2024-4183|2024-06-04T17:54:30.447Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 8.1.x before 8.1.12, 9.6.x before 9.6.1, 9.5.x before 9.5.3, 9.4.x before 9.4.5 fail to limit the number of active sessions, which allows an authenticated attacker to crash the server via repeated requests to the getSessions API after flooding the sessions table.

item.title: CVE-2024-4195|2024-06-04T17:54:34.811Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.6.0, 9.5.x before 9.5.3, and 8.1.x before 8.1.12 fail to fully validate role changes, which allows an attacker authenticated as a team admin to promote guests to team admins via crafted HTTP requests.

item.title: CVE-2024-29221|2024-06-04T17:57:08.139Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Improper Access Control in Mattermost Server versions 9.5.x before 9.5.2, 9.4.x before 9.4.4, 9.3.x before 9.3.3, 8.1.x before 8.1.11 lacked proper access control in the `/api/v4/users/me/teams` endpoint allowing a team admin to get the invite ID of their team, thus allowing them to invite users, even if the "Add Members" permission was explicitly removed from team admins.

item.title: CVE-2024-29215|2024-06-05T20:43:29.568Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.7.x <= 9.7.1, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1, 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to enforce proper access control which allows a user to run a slash command in a channel they are not a member of via linking a playbook run to that channel and running a slash command as a playbook task command.

item.title: CVE-2024-5272|2024-06-04T18:02:20.278Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1, 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to restrict the audience of the "custom_playbooks_playbook_run_updated" webhook event, which allows a guest on a channel with a playbook run linked to see all the details of the playbook run when the run is marked by finished.

item.title: CVE-2024-5270|2024-06-04T18:02:41.518Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.7.x <= 9.7.1, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to check if the email signup configuration option is enabled when a user requests to switch from SAML to Email. This allows the user to switch their authentication mail from SAML to email and possibly edit personal details that were otherwise non-editable and provided by the SAML provider.

item.title: CVE-2024-28949|2024-04-05T08:14:09.878Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Server versions 9.5.x before 9.5.2, 9.4.x before 9.4.4, 9.3.x before 9.3.3, 8.1.x before 8.1.11 don't limit the number of user preferences which allows an attacker to send a large number of user preferences potentially causing denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-28053|2024-03-15T09:08:04.993Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Resource Exhaustion in Mattermost Server versions 8.1.x before 8.1.10 fails to limit the size of the payload that can be read and parsed allowing an attacker to send a very large email payload and crash the server.

item.title: CVE-2024-36287|2024-06-14T15:36:56.846Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Desktop App versions <=5.7.0 fail to disable certain Electron debug flags which allows for bypassing TCC restrictions on macOS.

item.title: CVE-2024-39807|2024-07-03T08:31:58.312Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 and 9.8.0 fail to properly sanitize the recipients of a webhook event which allows an attacker monitoring webhook events to retrieve the channel IDs of archived or restored channels.

item.title: CVE-2024-39361|2024-07-03T08:35:43.118Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.8.0, 9.7.x <= 9.7.4, 9.6.x <= 9.6.2 and 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 fail to prevent users from specifying a RemoteId for their posts which allows an attacker to specify both a remoteId and the post ID, resulting in creating a post with a user-defined post ID. This can cause some broken functionality in the channel or thread with user-defined posts

item.title: CVE-2024-39830|2024-07-03T08:32:56.113Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.8.x <= 9.8.0, 9.7.x <= 9.7.4, 9.6.x <= 9.6.2 and 9.5.x <= 9.5.5, when shared channels are enabled, fail to use constant time comparison for remote cluster tokens which allows an attacker to retrieve the remote cluster token via a timing attack during remote cluster token comparison.

item.title: CVE-2024-6428|2024-07-03T08:44:34.225Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.8.0, 9.7.x <= 9.7.4, 9.6.x <= 9.6.2, 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 fail to prevent specifying a RemoteId when creating a new user which allows an attacker to specify both a remoteId and the user ID, resulting in creating a user with a user-defined user ID. This can cause some broken functionality in User Management such administrative actions against the user not working.

item.title: CVE-2024-39353|2024-07-03T08:37:16.395Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 and 9.8.0 fail to sanitize the RemoteClusterFrame payloads before audit logging them which allows a high privileged attacker with access to the audit logs to read message contents.

item.title: CVE-2024-36257|2024-07-03T08:29:10.457Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 and 9.8.0, when using shared channels with multiple remote servers connected, fail to check that the remote server A requesting the server B to update the profile picture of a user is the remote that actually has the user as a local one . This allows a malicious remote A to change the profile images of users that belong to another remote server C that is connected to the server A.

item.title: CVE-2024-39361|2024-07-03T15:12:16.370Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.8.0, 9.7.x <= 9.7.4, 9.6.x <= 9.6.2 and 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 fail to prevent users from specifying a RemoteId for their posts which allows an attacker to specify both a remoteId and the post ID, resulting in creating a post with a user-defined post ID. This can cause some broken functionality in the channel or thread with user-defined posts

item.title: CVE-2024-21848|2024-07-15T15:46:54.574Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Improper Access Control in Mattermost Server versions 8.1.x before 8.1.11 allows an attacker that is in a channel with an active call to keep participating in the call even if they are removed from the channel

item.title: CVE-2024-32945|2024-07-16T15:44:30.104Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Mobile Apps versions <=2.16.0 fail to protect against abuse of a globally shared MathJax state which allows an attacker to change the contents of a LateX post, by creating another post with specific macro definitions.

item.title: CVE-2024-4198|2024-07-24T19:30:36.514Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.6.0, 9.5.x before 9.5.3, and 8.1.x before 8.1.12 fail to fully validate role changes which allows an attacker authenticated as team admin to demote users to guest via crafted HTTP requests.

item.title: CVE-2024-41926|2024-08-01T14:32:10.107Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0 and 9.5.x <= 9.5.6 fail to validate the source of sync messages and only allow the correct remote IDs, which allows a malicious remote to set arbitrary RemoteId values for synced users and therefore claim that a user was synced from another remote.

item.title: CVE-2024-36492|2024-08-01T14:05:01.393Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5, 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to disallow the modification of local users when syncing users in shared channels. which allows a malicious remote to overwrite an existing local user.

item.title: CVE-2024-39777|2024-08-01T14:41:09.616Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5 and 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to disallow unsolicited invites to expose access to local channels, when shared channels are enabled, which allows a malicious remote to send an invite with the ID of an existing local channel, and that local channel will then become shared without the consent of the local admin.

item.title: CVE-2024-41144|2024-08-01T14:05:08.491Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5, 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to properly validate synced posts, when shared channels are enabled, which allows a malicious remote to create/update/delete arbitrary posts in arbitrary channels

item.title: CVE-2024-39832|2024-08-01T14:05:04.850Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5, 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to properly safeguard an error handling which allows a malicious remote to permanently delete local data by abusing dangerous error handling, when share channels were enabled.

item.title: CVE-2024-41162|2024-08-01T14:05:09.501Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5 and 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to disallow the modification of local channels by a remote, when shared channels are enabled, which allows a malicious remote to make an arbitrary local channel read-only.

item.title: CVE-2024-39839|2024-08-01T14:05:07.339Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5, 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to disallow users to set their own remote username, when shared channels were enabled, which allows a user on a remote to set their remote username prop to an arbitrary string, which would be then synced to the local server as long as the user hadn't been synced before.

item.title: CVE-2024-39837|2024-08-01T14:05:06.182Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6 fail to properly restrict channel creation which allows a malicious remote to create arbitrary channels, when shared channels were enabled.

item.title: CVE-2024-29977|2024-08-01T14:35:07.529Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6 fail to properly validate synced reactions, when shared channels are enabled, which allows a malicious remote to create arbitrary reactions on arbitrary posts

item.title: CVE-2024-39274|2024-08-01T14:05:02.518Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5 and 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to properly validate that the channel that comes from the sync message is a shared channel, when shared channels are enabled, which allows a malicious remote to add users to arbitrary teams and channels

item.title: CVE-2024-39839|2024-08-01T18:04:42.351Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5, 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to disallow users to set their own remote username, when shared channels were enabled, which allows a user on a remote to set their remote username prop to an arbitrary string, which would be then synced to the local server as long as the user hadn't been synced before.

item.title: CVE-2024-4198|2024-08-01T20:33:52.786Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.6.0, 9.5.x before 9.5.3, and 8.1.x before 8.1.12 fail to fully validate role changes which allows an attacker authenticated as team admin to demote users to guest via crafted HTTP requests.

item.title: CVE-2024-4183|2024-08-01T20:33:52.871Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 8.1.x before 8.1.12, 9.6.x before 9.6.1, 9.5.x before 9.5.3, 9.4.x before 9.4.5 fail to limit the number of active sessions, which allows an authenticated attacker to crash the server via repeated requests to the getSessions API after flooding the sessions table.

item.title: CVE-2024-4195|2024-08-01T20:33:52.915Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.6.0, 9.5.x before 9.5.3, and 8.1.x before 8.1.12 fail to fully validate role changes, which allows an attacker authenticated as a team admin to promote guests to team admins via crafted HTTP requests.

item.title: CVE-2024-3872|2024-08-01T20:26:57.005Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Mobile app versions 2.13.0 and earlier use a regular expression with polynomial complexity to parse certain deeplinks, which allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to freeze or crash the app via a long maliciously crafted link.

item.title: CVE-2024-4182|2024-08-01T20:33:52.520Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.6.0, 9.5.x before 9.5.3, 9.4.x before 9.4.5, and 8.1.x before 8.1.12 fail to handle JSON parsing errors in custom status values, which allows an authenticated attacker to crash other users' web clients via a malformed custom status.

item.title: CVE-2024-39837|2024-08-01T20:47:51.530Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6 fail to properly restrict channel creation which allows a malicious remote to create arbitrary channels, when shared channels were enabled.

item.title: CVE-2024-22091|2024-08-01T22:35:34.806Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 8.1.x <= 8.1.10, 9.6.x <= 9.6.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.2 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.11 fail to limit the size of a request path that includes user inputs which allows an attacker to cause excessive resource consumption, possibly leading to a DoS via sending large request paths

item.title: CVE-2024-21848|2024-08-01T22:27:36.465Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Improper Access Control in Mattermost Server versions 8.1.x before 8.1.11 allows an attacker that is in a channel with an active call to keep participating in the call even if they are removed from the channel

item.title: CVE-2024-32045|2024-08-02T02:06:42.837Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1, 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to enforce proper access controls for channel and team membership when linking a playbook run to a channel which allows members to link their runs to private channels they were not members of.

item.title: CVE-2024-31859|2024-08-02T01:59:49.900Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to perform proper authorization checks which allows a member running a playbook in an existing channel to be promoted to a channel admin

item.title: CVE-2024-32046|2024-08-02T02:06:42.822Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.6.x <= 9.6.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.2, 9.4.x <= 9.4.4 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.11 fail to remove detailed error messages in API requests even if the developer mode is off which allows an attacker to get information about the server such as the full path were files are stored

item.title: CVE-2024-37182|2024-08-02T03:50:55.403Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Desktop App versions <=5.7.0 fail to correctly prompt for permission when opening external URLs which allows a remote attacker to force a victim over the Internet to run arbitrary programs on the victim's system via custom URI schemes.

item.title: CVE-2024-36287|2024-08-02T03:37:03.683Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Desktop App versions <=5.7.0 fail to disable certain Electron debug flags which allows for bypassing TCC restrictions on macOS.

item.title: CVE-2024-36257|2024-08-02T03:37:03.658Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.5 and 9.8.0, when using shared channels with multiple remote servers connected, fail to check that the remote server A requesting the server B to update the profile picture of a user is the remote that actually has the user as a local one . This allows a malicious remote A to change the profile images of users that belong to another remote server C that is connected to the server A.

item.title: CVE-2024-36241|2024-08-02T03:30:13.174Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to enforce proper access controls which allows user to view arbitrary post contents via the /playbook add slash command

item.title: CVE-2024-36255|2024-08-02T03:37:03.667Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to perform proper input validation on post actions which allows an attacker to run a playbook checklist task command as another user via creating and sharing a deceptive post action that unexpectedly runs a slash command in some arbitrary channel.

item.title: CVE-2024-39274|2024-08-02T15:10:58.701Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5 and 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to properly validate that the channel that comes from the sync message is a shared channel, when shared channels are enabled, which allows a malicious remote to add users to arbitrary teams and channels

item.title: CVE-2024-39832|2024-08-07T14:09:31.969Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5, 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to properly safeguard an error handling which allows a malicious remote to permanently delete local data by abusing dangerous error handling, when share channels were enabled.

item.title: CVE-2024-28053|2024-08-12T13:40:25.079Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Resource Exhaustion in Mattermost Server versions 8.1.x before 8.1.10 fails to limit the size of the payload that can be read and parsed allowing an attacker to send a very large email payload and crash the server.

item.title: CVE-2024-8071|2024-08-22T06:39:54.830Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0 and 9.8.x <= 9.8.2 fail to restrict which roles can promote a user as system admin which allows a System Role with edit access to the permissions section of system console to update their role (e.g. member) to include the `manage_system` permission, effectively becoming a System Admin.

item.title: CVE-2024-32939|2024-08-22T06:29:01.203Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0, 9.8.x <= 9.8.2, when shared channels are enabled, fail to redact remote users' original email addresses stored in user props when email addresses are otherwise configured not to be visible in the local server."

item.title: CVE-2024-39836|2024-08-22T06:27:09.829Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0 and 9.8.x <= 9.8.2 fail to ensure that remote/synthetic users cannot create sessions or reset passwords, which allows the munged email addresses, created by shared channels, to be used to receive email notifications and to reset passwords, when they are valid, functional emails.

item.title: CVE-2024-39810|2024-08-22T06:30:11.602Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.7 and 9.10.x <= 9.10.0 fail to time limit and size limit the CA path file in the ElasticSearch configuration which allows a System Role with access to the Elasticsearch system console to add any file as a CA path field, such as /dev/zero and, after testing the connection, cause the application to crash.

item.title: CVE-2024-42411|2024-08-22T06:32:57.137Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0, 9.8.x <= 9.8.2 fail to restrict the input in POST /api/v4/users which allows a user to manipulate the creation date in POST /api/v4/users tricking the admin into believing their account is much older.

item.title: CVE-2024-43813|2024-08-22T06:30:58.923Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0 fail to enforce proper access controls which allows any authenticated user, including guests, to mark any channel inside any team as read for any user.

item.title: CVE-2024-40886|2024-08-22T06:32:11.786Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0, 9.8.x <= 9.8.2 fail to sanitize user inputs in the frontend that are used for redirection which allows for a one-click client-side path traversal that is leading to CSRF in User Management page of the system console.

item.title: CVE-2024-40884|2024-08-22T15:17:10.938Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0 fail to properly enforce permissions which allows a team admin user without "Add Team Members" permission to disable the invite URL.

item.title: CVE-2024-43780|2024-08-22T15:17:11.947Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.0, 9.8.x <= 9.8.2 fail to enforce permissions which allows a guest user with read access to upload files to a channel.

item.title: CVE-2024-42497|2024-08-22T15:31:45.824Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0, 9.8.x <= 9.8.2 fail to properly enforce permissions which allows a user with systems manager role with read-only access to teams to perform write operations on teams.

item.title: CVE-2024-40884|2024-08-22T18:08:37.730Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0 fail to properly enforce permissions which allows a team admin user without "Add Team Members" permission to disable the invite URL.

item.title: CVE-2024-43105|2024-08-23T07:25:00.371Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost Plugin Channel Export versions <=1.0.0 fail to restrict concurrent runs of the /export command which allows a user to consume excessive resource by running the /export command multiple times at once.

item.title: CVE-2024-34152|2024-09-03T16:03:29.404Z -- mattermost -- mattermost
item.description: Mattermost versions 9.5.x <= 9.5.3, 9.6.x <= 9.6.1 and 8.1.x <= 8.1.12 fail to perform proper access control which allows a guest to get the metadata of a public playbook run that linked to the channel they are guest via sending an RHSRuns GraphQL query request to the server
